content.question: A projectile launched from a cliff at time <math alttext="t equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> follows the path indicated by the dashed line in the above figure. The axes indicate the positive horizontal and vertical directions. Which of the following graphs could represent the projectile’s motion?

choices.label: The figure shows a graph of a line in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the vertical axis is labeled “Horizontal Position.” The line begins near the top of the vertical axis, and moves horizontally to the right until it ends.

The figure shows a graph of a line in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the vertical axis is labeled “Horizontal Velocity.” The line begins at the origin, and moves upward and to the right until it ends.

The figure shows a graph of a line in the first and fourth quadrants of a coordinate plane with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the vertical axis is labeled “Vertical Velocity.” The line begins on the vertical axis above the origin, and moves downward and to the right. It crosses the horizontal axis and ends far below the horizontal axis and to the right of the vertical axis.

The figure shows a graph of two line segments in the first and fourth quadrants of a coordinate plane with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the vertical axis is labeled “Vertical Acceleration.” The first line segment begins on the vertical axis above the origin, and moves horizontally to the right until it reaches a point about one fourth of the way along the axis. The second line segment begins directly below where the first line segment ends, near the bottom of the vertical axis, and moves horizontally to the right until it ends. A dashed vertical line connects the two horizontal line segments.

content.answer: The figure shows a graph of a line in the first and fourth quadrants of a coordinate plane with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the vertical axis is labeled “Vertical Velocity.” The line begins on the vertical axis above the origin, and moves downward and to the right. It crosses the horizontal axis and ends far below the horizontal axis and to the right of the vertical axis.

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
